subject: Re: [junit] Using JUnit on an RMI Server
msgSnippet: ...  GSBase also ships a serializability test if you prefer not to code your own. -- J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger Diaspar Software Services
messageBody:
Ilja Preuss wrote:
> junit@yahoogroups.com wrote:
> > David Whyte wrote:
> >> >
> >> > I would suggest you mock the RMI server interface. You
> > shouldn't
> >>> need to test the operation of the server itself. >
> >>
> >> Hmmm...yeah. I just want to check that I am sending everything
> >> across correctly, such as serialized objects, and no local
> >> references, that kind of stuff.
> >
> > These sound like Learning Tests for RMI.
>
> And you might want to test that the objects you are sending serialize and
> deserialize correctly.
<snip-code />

GSBase also ships a serializability test if you prefer not to code your own.
